Storybook Roadmap: A Complete Guide [2025 Updated]

Master Storybook in 2025 with this roadmap covering new release cadence, accessibility, component testing, ecosystem integration, and upcoming improvements.

Summary of Roadmap

Storybook maintains an active public roadmap on GitHub, releasing minor versions every ~8 weeks and majors annually (usually Feb/Mar) :contentReference[oaicite:3]{index=3}.

1. Recent Release – Storybook 8.5

Introduced Realtime a11y testing via Axe, project-level code coverage, focused component tests, React Native Web Vite support, and Test Bootcamp :contentReference[oaicite:4]{index=4}.

2. Test & Accessibility Integration

Built-in component tests with Vitest, Axe-based accessibility linting, and coverage reports.

3. Framework API & Builder Upgrades

Framework API supports zero-config across Vite, Next.js, SvelteKit, Remix, Nuxt; Vite builder prioritized, Turbopack integration in progress :contentReference[oaicite:5]{index=5}.

4. React Native, Svelte, Vue Enhancements

React Native Web Vite framework, Vite 6 support, Svelte Test integration, Angular 19 support :contentReference[oaicite:6]{index=6}.

5. Portable Documentation & Testing

Portable stories, new Docs iteration, full-page app testing support.

6. Next-generation Architecture

New build server separated from build process, performance gains, ecosystem CI tests :contentReference[oaicite:7]{index=7}.

7. Upcoming (Storybook 9.0) & RFCs

CSF factories for typesafety/autocomplete; enhancements to Test and Docs setup; accessibility improvements for all stories :contentReference[oaicite:8]{index=8}.

8. Contributor Workflow & Releases

Tracking through RFC/issues -> tracking issues -> in-progress -> done in minor releases.

9. Community & Ecosystem

Public roadmap board, community RFC process, contributor-driven features.

10. Best Practices

- Adopt component test + a11y pipeline early - Migrate to Vite or Turbopack builders - Use Framework API for zero-config setup - Follow roadmap and upvote RFCs
